We’re hiring a Billing Analyst to ensure accurate and timely invoicing by managing billing processes, interpreting reports, and collaborating with cross-functional teams.

Position Title: Mid-Level Billing Analyst

Location: Remote - Colombia
What you will be doing:
The Billing Analyst will support billing operations across multiple offices. This role focuses on executing daily, weekly, and monthly billing tasks with accuracy and timeliness, ensuring proper invoicing and financial reporting. You will work closely with Engagement Support teams, leveraging Excel and Power BI reports to manage billing workflows. Your responsibilities will include:
  • Monitor billing-related communications and queues for urgent items.
  • Maintain and refresh invoice tracking systems across assigned offices.
  • Review and process unbilled items using Power BI and other tools.
  • Prepare, deliver, and revise invoice drafts, including applying discounts and reason codes.
  • Resolve draft rejections and manage undrafted or off-cadence billing items.
  • Respond to billing inquiries, tickets, and service requests.
  • Perform invoice reversals, re-submissions, and related research.
  • Maintain accurate documentation, including reason codes and processing notes.
  • Escalate aged billing items and collaborate with Engagement Support teams.
  • Conduct audits on billing data, delivery methods, and placeholder entries.
  • Clean up $0 fixed fee time entries and submit late time entries and expenses.
  • Complete time-sensitive tasks such as updating Fixed Fee input dates (Mondays), Expense input dates (Expense Days), and Time input dates (month-end).

Requirements & Qualifications
To excel in this role, you should possess:

  • 2–4 years of experience in billing, accounts receivable/payable, or accounting.
  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
  • Proficiency in Excel and ability to interact with and interpret Power BI reports.
  • Familiarity with financial systems and billing processes.
  • Experience in professional services billing.
  • Familiarity with ERP or financial reporting systems.
  • Proactive problem-solving and process improvement mindset.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent communication skills and a willingness to learn.

Recognized for leveraging advanced technology in enterprise environments, Lean Tech is known for its integration of leading platforms and its dedication to data quality, process automation, and business efficiency. With a dynamic team and a passion for optimizing human resources technology, Lean Tech contributes to measurable improvements in recruiting and operational outcomes.
We’re hiring a Mid+ Data Engineer who will enhance our talent acquisition experience by automating workflows, streamlining data flows, and delivering innovative solutions that make our recruiting technology ecosystem more efficient, scalable, and aligned with HR and business goals.

 

Position Title

Mid+ Data Engineer
Location: Remote - Colombia

 

What You Will Be Doing

The primary purpose of this role is to optimize and integrate Avature with key platforms such as Workday, Salesforce (Jobscience), and ServiceNow, supporting critical HR processes within the Talent Acquisition function. You will lead complex data migrations and develop advanced ETL processes to ensure the accuracy, integrity, and seamless flow of recruiting data across the HR technology ecosystem.
By collaborating closely with recruiters, HR systems specialists, and cross-functional partners, you will streamline data flows, automate workflows, and deliver solutions that enhance hiring efficiency and contribute to business success. This role is integral to shaping robust data management practices, supporting data cleanup and mapping, contributing to data retention policy definition, and ensuring compliance standards are met.
Your responsibilities will include:
  • Design, build, and optimize ETL processes to migrate data from legacy systems—such as Jobscience—to Avature, ensuring data integrity and consistency throughout each phase of migration.

  • Analyze, map, and document source data fields to corresponding target fields, establishing clear data transformation and mapping logic for all migration activities.

  • Identify and resolve data quality issues by performing data cleansing, deduplication, and validation tasks to improve the accuracy and usability of migrated data.

  • Collaborate with HR technology stakeholders, recruiters, system administrators, and cross-functional partners to gather integration requirements, troubleshoot migration challenges, and develop data solutions with platforms such as Workday, Salesforce, and ServiceNow.

  • Coordinate and execute both development-phase data extracts and full production migrations, ensuring smooth transitions and minimal business disruption.

  • Support data exports from Avature to analytics platforms such as Snowflake, ensuring proper formatting, secure transfer, and preservation of data integrity.

  • Document all ETL processes, migration steps, and data mappings to support transparency, reproducibility, and knowledge sharing within the team.

  • Contribute to the definition and implementation of data retention policies, ensuring compliance with both regulatory and organizational requirements.

 

Requirements & Qualifications

To excel in this role, you should possess:
  • 3+ years of hands-on experience designing, building, and optimizing ETL processes for complex data migrations between enterprise platforms.

  • Proficiency with ETL tools such as Talend, Informatica, SSIS, or equivalent, as well as scripting skills using Python and SQL.

  • Strong understanding of data migration concepts, including data mapping, transformation, cleansing, deduplication, and validation.

  • Experience analyzing and mapping source and target data fields, including clear documentation of transformation and mapping logic for migrations.

  • Ability to identify and resolve data quality issues, performing data cleanup and deduplication to improve reliability and usability.

  • Proven attention to data accuracy, integrity, and consistency throughout all migration and integration processes.

  • Demonstrated experience collaborating with business stakeholders, system administrators, and subject matter experts to define requirements and troubleshoot data challenges.

  • Proficiency in documenting ETL processes, migration steps, and data mappings to support transparency, reproducibility, and compliance.

  • Familiarity with data retention, archiving, and compliance practices in line with regulatory and organizational requirements.

  • Adaptability to support both development-phase data extracts and full production migrations, adjusting to evolving project needs.

  • Moderate experience with Avature, Salesforce-based platforms (such as Jobscience), and data warehousing solutions like Snowflake, with the ability to comfortably extract and load data from these systems.

We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented professional to join our Technology Business Management (TBM) team.   • Ensure alignment with corporate procurement policies and financial governance.

  • Experience using Power BI dashboards (power user, not developer).
